commits.summary: README: add noniq to maintainers.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Exclude markup.raw from italic fix
commits.body: As this would be raw text nothing should be matched here.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Exclude markup.bold from italic fix
commits.body: This was improperly matching the first half of the possible closing `__`.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Exclude markup.italic scope from italic fix
commits.body: This prevents the case of the rule from the main grammar having already being entered and not being able to exit as expected.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Correct location of look-behind assertion
commits.body: A quirk of the engine allows the old to somewhat work but it should be looking before the `_`.

commits.author: Stefan Daschek
commits.summary: Update installation instructions
commits.body:
TextMate 2 no longer uses `Avian/Bundles`.

After updating the installation instructions for TM 2 accordingly, they were identical to the installation instructions for TM 1 (except for the AppleScript snippet to reload all bundles), so I decided to unify both instructions into one single paragraph (not sure if anyone still uses TM 1 anyway).

commits.author: Stefan Daschek
commits.summary: Improve handling of words with underscores.
commits.body:
Prior to this fix, words containing two underscores would screw up highlighting: The `markup.italic.markdown` scope would extend beyond the end of the word, preventing all other rules (e.g. for headers, ‚Ä¶) from matching.

Fixes #20.

commits.author: ReneÃÅ Schwaiger
commits.summary: Insert Code Block: Use Markdown scope
commits.body:
Before this change it was easily possible to insert code blocks in non
Markdown documents. For example: We could also add a Markdown code
block to a Ruby document, if we inserted a back-tick and then hit `<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>‚á•</kbd>`.

commits.author: ReneÃÅ Schwaiger
commits.summary: Grammar: Add syntax highlighting support for YAML

commits.author: Mike McQuaid
commits.summary: Add Travis CI.
commits.body: Do some basic Ruby and XML syntax validation.

commits.author: Stefan Daschek
commits.summary: Mention tab trigger for insert block snippet in readme.

commits.author: Stefan Daschek
commits.summary: Add snippet for inserting a code block.
commits.body:
Tab trigger: <kbd>`<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>‚á•</kbd></kbd> (that is, a single backtick and then pressing the tab key). Note that typing a single backtick will insert two backticks (with the cursor in between), because the Markdown bundle defines an appropriate smart typing pair. This is why the snippet inserts only two backticks at the end of the code block: Together with the backtick already inserted by the smart typing pair this gives three backticks at the end.

The snippet shows a completion list for specifying the language of the code block. The list of supported languages was extracted from the bundle‚Äôs grammar. If at some point in the future more languages are added to the grammar, these languages should be added to the completion list as well.

commits.author: Stefan Daschek
commits.summary: Fix quoting when setting TM_MARKDOWN.
commits.body: See https://github.com/MikeMcQuaid/GitHub-Markdown.tmbundle/pull/10#issuecomment-237240547

commits.author: Stefan Daschek
commits.summary: Set TM_MARKDOWN instead of duplicating preview command.
commits.body: As discussed by @sorbits in http://lists.macromates.com/textmate/2016-July/039722.html this achieves the same result with less code. And it will also allow to use TM_MARKDOWN_FILTER for things like stripping front matter in the future.

commits.author: Mike McQuaid
commits.summary: Migrate more font preferences to font bundle.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Change language specifier scope to storage.type.language
commits.body: This scope is not currently used in the markdown grammar so it can stand out more.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Remove theming settings items
commits.body: We generally do not want theming items as part of installed bundles to reduce unexpected behaviors.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Rename grammar to better fit role

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Rewrite table rule
commits.body: Better matches the cell contents allowing for inline rules, matches headers separately.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Increase specificity of injection scope
commits.body: This prevents items from being injected inside other rules except the paragraph block.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Remove fileTypes and keyEquivalent
commits.body: Since we never want these to be directly used.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Add contentName to meta.embedded blocks
commits.body: This provides the proper scope to allow various bundle items to function.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Remove 'markdown.github' prefix to embedded type
commits.body: The type of code being embedded is the more important information here we want to bring it to the forefront. What it is embedded in can be deduced from the parent scope.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Add scope to raw ending punctuation

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Remove unused captures
commits.body: Zero-width assertions are not given scopes so these were not used. Also add comment to explain the use of this rule.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Limit intra-word underscore match to italic rules
commits.body: Before this could match in raw contexts where not desired.
